explanation: The stage direction 'Il ouvre le treillage, et l'on voit la Comtesse à la place de la statue.' indicates that a character (Il) performs an action (ouvre) that leads to another character (la Comtesse) becoming visible on stage. This fits the definition of 'entrance' as it describes a character entering the stage, albeit in a unique way (revealed through the opening of a treillage).
stgdir: II ouvre le treillage, et l'on voit la Comtesse à la place de la statue.
